name: Hilton Portland & Executive Tower

reviews.text: My stay at the Hilton has been disappointing at best. The lobby gives a good impression, but the room is tiny. Not a lot of space to move around, much like a NYC hotel but this is not Manhattan.
reviews.title: Did not meet expectations for Hilton brand

likes.disliked: — Lack of space/small room, no hot water, not as clean as expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, the furniture looks a bit old and worn out. The bathroom tile was not clean, it reminds me of a youth hostel. I'm wishing I had brought a pair of flip flops with me to wear in the shower. Didn't think it would be necessary at a Hilton Hotel. On top of that, there was no hot water in the dead of winter. I've called front desk a couple of times and they assure me Engineering has resolved the issue with the boilers. My senses though indicate the contrary- water is not even warm! Only positive is that the bed is comfortable.
reviews.title: Do not stay here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: How this place has 4 or 3.5 stars totally escapes me. I have actually stayed in much nicer lower end motels than this place.
reviews.title: NOT WORTH 50 bucks A NIGHT!

reviews.text: The room was run down and dirty. The towels were stained, rough, and thin. There was hair on the towels as well.
reviews.title: Dud

reviews.text: The bathroom had been redone, but the rest of the room hadn't and was nasty. And, the hot water didn't get hot! Seriously, I had a luke warm shower. The heat also didn't work properly in our room and was so loud it was like an airplane landing.
reviews.title: Is this NYC?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a few days a couple years ago with my husband. Read the Trip Advisor reviews and requested a room in the Executive Tower. The room was nice, modern, spacious, and clean. Location of the hotel is excellent - close to restaurants, shopping, and sights. There's been quite a few negative reviews I've noticed, so not sure if that's because people are staying in the old tower, or if the hotel has gone downhill since we last stayed here. IWe enjoyed our stay though. In general however, I find the Hilton chain to be unreliable - they tend to just buy old hotels and partially refurbish them. Very hit and miss.
reviews.title: Stay in the Executive Tower

reviews.text: Stayed here for the first round of the NCAA tourney. The facilities are what you would expect from a Hilton, the rooms were nice and the pool was excellent. The thing that set this hilton apart was the over the top customer service from the staff. Every staff member we encountered went out of their way to be as helpful as possilbe. You expect good solid customer service from Hilton staff members in general, but this service went beyond that. It's a great location right in the middle of Downtown Portland. This is an easy hotel to reccomend.
reviews.title: Standard Hilton with a great staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have stayed here a couple of times previously. The rooms in the executive tower were nice sized - especially when compared with the rooms our friends were staying in at the "nicer" hotel a couple of blocks away. Bed was comfortable and hotel was quiet.
reviews.title: Overall a nice stay

reviews.text: Staff was friendly - check-in was fast, called down for additional coffe and it was there in just a couple of minutes and the valet had the car pulled up by the time we made it down to the lobby.
reviews.title: Small, cold, expensive, quiet
a quality hotel in downtown Portland!!
reviews.text: Only issue was very little hot water in the morning - my shower was luke warm and my partners was cold.
After reading the other reviews, I asked for a room in the Executive Tower in advance.
reviews.title: Dusty windows, a wet chair

likes.liked: — The food at the restaurant and from the catering department -- top notch (and the service too)
likes.disliked: — Other than the dusty windows and the wet chair?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: "We couldn't possibly," snipped the manager at check in "you never requested that," she continued.
reviews.title: Most Comfy Bed EVER!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Off to the old part of the hotel I went where I was greeted by a room with windows so dusty I could write my name on them.
reviews.title: Hilton a Rip-Off

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Worse, the chair and ottoman and the room was wet as was part of the carpet (apparently from a recent cleaning). The hotel promptly washed the window the next day.
reviews.title: Downtown Portland Hilton & Executive Tower

likes.liked: — Location witin downtown Portland...it was close to everything!

reviews.text: The room furnishings were dated, the carpet had seen its better day.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location

reviews.text: Spent four nights here for a conference, room booked and paid for by the conference organizers.
reviews.title: Good experience

likes.disliked: — Slow lobby computers, so flight check in not actually possible.

reviews.text: Overall very good experience, with clean, comfortable room. Extremely comfortable bed. Bathroom very recently renovated and nicely done. Hair dryer poor quality---I actually bought one to use.
reviews.title: Hilton Rocks!

likes.liked: — Business amenities, two great lounges on-site and downtown location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No noise problems, despite my room being next to the elevators (that wall away from the head of the bed).
reviews.title: Great Location, Small Room

reviews.text: Reception desk staff, door men, and concierge all fine.
reviews.title: Overpriced for what you get; very cramped and outdated

reviews.text: Food for the meeting was better than usual for this type of thing. The ballrooms are subterranean, and very well-blocked insofar as cell phones, etc. are involved. Good if you want to avoid disturbances during the lectures, bad if you need access.
reviews.title: Portland Hilton - So-so rooms, GREAT service

aka: Hilton Portland & Executive Tower Hotel Portland
description: The Hilton Portland & Executive Tower hotel in Portland, consists of two separate buildings and combined they offer 782 guest rooms as well as: The Main building, remodeled in 2006 offers:* Complimentary Hilton Athletic Club - offering a large indoor pool, Jacuzzi®, extensive cardiovascular equipment, free weights, sauna and steam room, tanning, personal fitness training and massage services* Bistro 921 Restaurant & Bar - where you can enjoy classic American fare * Full-service business center - staffed Mon-Fri and 24-hour access with room key * Wireless HSIA available in all guestrooms * Hotel guests can also enjoy complimentary wireless access in the lobby area* Parking garage - Each building has their own garage for your added convenienceThe Executive Tower showcases:* Concierge desk * Porto Terra Tuscan Grill & Bar - featuring Northern Italian cuisine* Complimentary 24-hour fitness room with an indoor waveless lap pool * 24-hour self-serve business center * Wired and wireless HSIA available in all guestrooms * Hotel guests can also enjoy complimentary wireless access in the lobby area* Parking garage - Each building has their own garage for your added convenience
